page.title: 02Changing Times.
page.content: { We found in our interview with Mr C Flower that life in Norton Radstock has changed a great deal.He started work in the coal mines at the age of 14_he is now 73.There were many mines in the area and he worked in the Old Mills Pit.There were 300 men down his pit and they used 13 horses.Each man had to supply his own tools.The coal was brought to the surface in the cage and railways carried it to other parts.Today all the pits have closed and the railways stopped.Life down the mines was dark,smokey,dirty,wet and dangerous.There were many accidents and it was very hard work.Miners were paid 11shillings and 3 pence(55p.)per week but they had free coal.He thought that life was easier today but he enjoyed his working days as a miner.
